Internal queue sizing
[IPDR reliability mechanism]

The parameter configuration.queueMaxMemory (see Configuration values for inialization (programmatically/MIB)) controls the size of the internal queue. It can be set to 0 (meaning unlimited). If a limit is set, it should be:
maximum-records-per-second � * (average-record-length + 16) �worst-case-failover-time.

(16 is the length of the IPDR record header.)

When the queue fills up, each new record is thrown away and the IPDR_EVENT_RECORD_LOST event is raised. (The reasons for throwing away the new record and not removing the oldest record are (a) it's much more complicated to program and (b) the oldest record might be partially transmitted and there is no way in general to abort its transfer.

The queue size affects the configuration of a de-duplicator (see De-duplication for more details).
